title: Recommendation for reusable straws? : r/ZeroWaste - Reddit
body: The silicone straws would be a perfect material if you, just like me, hate the hard reusable straws. I like chewing on the plastic straws but they re just so horrible for literally everything and everyone. strawhutco.com has some options for straws and amazonhas tons of options too.
readable_content:
- BM0R3Natural (2017-12-08): I recently purchased these and am loving the way the silicone feels.  
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B074295RQ5/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_api_i_n91dBbPGPQWHD
- auntiefrond (2017-12-08): I've never used one but I know that there are bamboo straws that people really like.
- TigerFern (2017-12-08): You can get silicon tips for metal straws if you already have one
- Wuz314159 (2017-12-08): Recommendation: Don't use straws. (Had to be said)
- [deleted] (2017-12-08): Nah, I get you. I like straws for acidic drinks to bypass my teeth though
summary:
The conversation shows a range of opinions on using alternatives to plastic straws, from enjoying silicone tips to advocating for not using straws at all. Each individual has their own preference, from bamboo straws to metal straws with silicone tips. Overall, there is an awareness of the issue and a willingness to explore alternatives. 

Sentiment: 0.6
